title: Strategies for Applying Mobile-Based Instructional Design Models for Adult Working Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Applying instructional design models to enhance the effectiveness of language education in smartphone-centric, technology-constrained environments.

learning_goals: Learners can create a language education design document optimized for mobile learning environments by applying the ADDIE model.
Learners can design microlearning content that enhances workplace learners' engagement by utilizing the ARCS (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction) motivation theory.
Learners can propose three or more formative assessment strategies executable in restricted technological environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
